intro: Drepananthus ramuliflorus, commonly known as the threadleaf mallow, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features slender, branching stems covered with small, thread-like leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow flowers with five petals, typical of the Malvaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Its delicate appearance and unique foliage make it a notable species in botanical studies.
